lom:description.lom:string: "Although many computer professionals believe that inherent or deeply ingrained gender differences make women less suited to the study and practice of computer science [5, 9], the results reported here demonstrate that female underrepresentation in computer science could be avoided. Women can and do succeed in computer science (CS) when conditions do not deter them. The variation that occurs in womenÂ’s participation rates demonstrates that many women succeed as computer scientists in certain times and settings. Conditions affecting female retention in undergraduate computer science are identified in this article."

lom:keyword.lom:string: computing, computer science, gender, confidence, female, male, women, engage, teaching, classes, classroom, culture

lom:title.lom:string: Toward improving female retention in the computer science major
